title: cool project going cheap new price ¬£400 on ebay - got to go

posts.content:
I bought this a while back with the intention of fixing it up after doing my split projects, but I have just been laid off and I am having a bit of a clear out so my Kit is up for sale.

I originally thought it was a Siva Saluki but I have since found out it is a Charger, the guy that sold it to me said he had the engine running and it was running ok but the clutch cable has broke so he couldn't drive it.

As you can see in the photo's the doors are there and it comes with the box of goodies

Alloys are worth a fair few quid and i was told the speedo with the fuel gauge is from a super beetle and fairly hard to come by.

It owes me around £900 but I am open to sensible offers

NEW PRICE OF £800

viewtopic.php?f=8&t=67504

all you need to do is a "weekends" work put petrol in and away you go

All the parts are there for the doors etc and would look ace back on the road and being based on a beetle all the parts are available.

I really wanted to go to town with this bad boy and get face recognition, like you get on some lap tops, for an entry system and voice control for the stereo etc but reality hits hard and I need the money and just don't have the time, what with trying to Finish Benidict and finally, after 3 years, get Laura on the road for the summer and start enjoying my buses instead of being underneath them.

http://s512.photobucket.com/albums/t326 ... %20saluki/

As you can tell by the new subject heading I have had a play with the engine today.

took the battery off my car, and used jump leads to starter and gear box, touch of petrol in the carb, turn the ignition key on, cleaned the end of the rotor arm, bridged the starter with a spanner and away she went.

I didn't want to connect the fuel line up to the petrol can as I done that to my 911 engine after it sat for ages and buggered the jets so before I go and get fuel running to it I'll have the carb off and clean the resovour.

Jason

Now on ebay for £400

http://cgi.ebay.co.uk/ws/eBayISAPI.dll? ... 640wt_1139

Hey Everyone realising this post was put a long time it's a bit of a shot in the dark, im reaching out to talk to anyone who knows much about the Siva Saluki's. I've got one of the three in my garage at home and could use any support or info anyone has about the other Saluki's.

Email is Lloyd15678@gmail.com
